00026  * Revision 1.2  2008/05/13 15:50:02  vanvoor4
00027  * Not sure why I had previously decided to copy the data in a
00028  * node container rather than returning a pointer to the data
00029  * container.
00030  *
00031  * Revision 1.1  2008/02/26 19:14:30  vanvoor4
00032  * Initial checkin of a "simple" Octree.  Just need something that works
00033  * for now and is faster than brute force.  The actual tree method is
00034  * no different from the previous implementation, but the data supported
00035  * is not quite as general.
00036  *
00037  *

00040 #ifndef SIMPLE_OCTREE_HEADER_INCLUDED
00041 #define SIMPLE_OCTREE_HEADER_INCLUDED
00042 
00043 #include <vector>
00044 #include <queue>
00045 #include <algorithm>
00046 #include <iostream>
00047 #include <cstring>
00048 #include <types.H>
00049 
00050 template<typename _Tp>
00051 class octree_node_t{
00052   typedef _Tp                                   value_type;
00053 
00054 public:
00055 
00056   octree_node_t()
00057   {
00058     parent = 0;
00059     half_width = 0;
00060     std::memset(children, 0, 8 * sizeof(octree_node_t*));
00061     std::fill(centroid, centroid + 3, 0);
00062   }
00063 
00067   octree_node_t(octree_node_t& src)
00068   {
00069     if(this == &src) return;
00070 
00071     parent = src.parent;
00072     half_width = src.half_width;
00073     std::copy(src.children, src.children + 8, children);
00074     std::copy(src.centroid, src.centroid + 3, centroid);
00075     data = src.data; 
00076   }
00077 
00078   octree_node_t* parent;
00079   octree_node_t* children[8];
00080   my_float_t centroid[3];
00081   my_float_t half_width;  
00082 
00083   std::vector<_Tp> data;   
00084 };
00085 
00087 
00090 template<typename _Tp>
00091 class SimpleOctree{
00092   typedef _Tp                                   value_type;
00093 
00094 public:
00095 
00096   typedef struct{
00097     const std::vector<_Tp>* bin_data;
00098     std::vector<const my_float_t*> positions;
00099   }bin_type;
00100 
00101 
00102   SimpleOctree(const my_float_t min_half_width, const uint max_numel = 1)
00103   {
00104     A_min_half_width = min_half_width;
00105     A_max_numel = max_numel;
00106   }
00107 
00108   ~SimpleOctree()
00109   {
00110     // Need to deallocate the tree here
00111   }
00112 
00113   void
00114   build(_Tp pts_begin, _Tp pts_end)
00115   {
00116     if(pts_end <= pts_begin) return;
00117 
00118     // Spin through the positions to find the min and max values
00119     my_float_t max_pt[3], min_pt[3];
00120     std::copy(pts_begin->pos, pts_begin->pos + 3, max_pt);
00121     std::copy(pts_begin->pos, pts_begin->pos + 3, min_pt);
00122     for(_Tp p = pts_begin; p < pts_end; ++p){
00123       for(uint i = 0; i < 3; ++i){
00124         if(max_pt[i] < p->pos[i]) max_pt[i] = p->pos[i];
00125         if(min_pt[i] > p->pos[i]) min_pt[i] = p->pos[i];
00126       }
00127     }
00128 
00129     // Compute the centroid and add the tolerance to each coordinate of min 
00130     // and max to obtain the root side len.
00131     my_float_t max_side_len = 0;
00132     for(uint i = 0; i < 3; ++i){
00133       max_pt[i] += A_min_half_width;
00134       min_pt[i] -= A_min_half_width; 
00135       my_float_t len = max_pt[i] - min_pt[i];
00136       if(len > max_side_len) max_side_len = len;
00137     }
00138 
00139     my_float_t root_side_len = A_min_half_width;
00140     while(max_side_len > A_min_half_width){
00141       max_side_len *= 0.5;
00142       root_side_len *= 2;
00143     }
00144 
00145     for(uint i = 0; i < 3; ++i)
00146       A_root.centroid[i] = 0.5 * (max_pt[i] + min_pt[i]);
00147     A_root.half_width = 0.5 * root_side_len;
00148 
00149     // Copy data to root node
00150     A_root.data.reserve(pts_end - pts_begin);
00151     for(_Tp p = pts_begin; p < pts_end; ++p) A_root.data.push_back(p);
00152     
00153     subdivide_with_overlap(&A_root);
00154   }
00155 
00156 
00157   // Should make non overlapping bins  -- this makes the 
00158   // "search" easier at the cost of storing more pointers.  However, to me,
00159   // this seems like a much easier method to implement and a bit faster 
00160   // than searching for the nodes that are near a query point.
00161   void
00162   subdivide_with_overlap(octree_node_t<_Tp>* cnode)
00163   {
00164     if(cnode->data.size() <= A_max_numel) return;
00165     my_float_t h_width = 0.5 * cnode->half_width;
00166     if(h_width < A_min_half_width) return;
00167 
00168     // partition based on the position of each point 
00169     const my_float_t* centroid = cnode->centroid;
00170 
00171     std::vector<_Tp>& data = cnode->data;
00172     for(size_t pt_idx = 0; pt_idx < data.size(); ++pt_idx){
00173       const _Tp& pt = data[pt_idx];
00174    
00175       std::vector<bool> above(3, false), below(3, false);
00176       for(uint i = 0; i < 3; ++i){
00177         if((pt->pos[i] - A_min_half_width) <= centroid[i]) below[i] = true;
00178         if((pt->pos[i] + A_min_half_width) >= centroid[i]) above[i] = true;
00179       }
00180 
00181       // Explicitly write out the 8 cases -- likely to be easier to read
00182       std::vector<bool> pt_in_bins(8, false);
00183       pt_in_bins[0] = (below[0] && below[1] && below[2]);
00184       pt_in_bins[1] = (above[0] && below[1] && below[2]);
00185       pt_in_bins[2] = (below[0] && above[1] && below[2]);
00186       pt_in_bins[3] = (above[0] && above[1] && below[2]);
00187       pt_in_bins[4] = (below[0] && below[1] && above[2]);
00188       pt_in_bins[5] = (above[0] && below[1] && above[2]);
00189       pt_in_bins[6] = (below[0] && above[1] && above[2]);
00190       pt_in_bins[7] = (above[0] && above[1] && above[2]);
00191        
00192       for(uint i = 0; i < 8; ++i){
00193         if(!pt_in_bins[i]) continue;
00194 
00195         octree_node_t<_Tp>* child = cnode->children[i];
00196         if(!child){
00197           cnode->children[i] = new octree_node_t<_Tp>;
00198           child = cnode->children[i];
00199           child->parent = cnode;
00200           child->half_width = h_width;
00201           uint dim_mask = 1; 
00202           for(uint j = 0; j < 3; ++j, dim_mask <<= 1)
00203             if(i & dim_mask) child->centroid[j] = centroid[j] + h_width;
00204             else child->centroid[j] = centroid[j] - h_width;
00205         }
00206         child->data.push_back(pt);
00207       }
00208     }
00209 
00210     // Recursively subdivide children
00211     for(uint i = 0; i < 8; ++i)
00212       if(cnode->children[i]){
00213         subdivide_with_overlap(cnode->children[i]);
00214         cnode->data.clear();
00215       }
00216   }
00217 
00218   const std::vector<_Tp>*
00219   near_by_points(const my_float_t* pos, const my_float_t max_dist)
00220   {
00221     const octree_node_t<_Tp>* cnode = &A_root;
00222     my_float_t h_width;
00223     const my_float_t h_max_dist = 0.5 * max_dist;
00224     for(h_width = A_root.half_width; h_width > h_max_dist; h_width *= 0.5){
00225       uint cube_idx = 0;
00226       if(pos[0] > cnode->centroid[0]) cube_idx += 1;
00227       if(pos[1] > cnode->centroid[1]) cube_idx += 2;
00228       if(pos[2] > cnode->centroid[2]) cube_idx += 4;
00229 
00230       if(cnode->children[cube_idx] == 0) break;
00231       cnode = cnode->children[cube_idx];
00232     }
00233    
00234     return &(cnode->data);
00235   }
00236 
00240 
00243   void
00244   bin_positions(const std::vector<const my_float_t*> &pos_vec, 
00245                 const my_float_t max_dist,
00246                 std::vector<bin_type> *bins)
00247   {
00248     bin_positions(A_root, max_dist, pos_vec, bins);
00249   }
00250 
00251 private:
00252 
00253   // Needs more testing
00254   void
00255   bin_positions(octree_node_t<_Tp> &cnode, const my_float_t max_dist,
00256                 const std::vector<const my_float_t*> &pos_vec,
00257                 std::vector<bin_type> *bins)
00258   {
00259     // If data is stored in the current it node, the assumption is the current
00260     // node is a leaf node.
00261     if(cnode.data.size()){
00262       bin_type bin;
00263       bin.bin_data = &(cnode.data);
00264       bin.positions.resize(pos_vec.size()); 
00265       std::vector<const my_float_t*>::const_iterator p_iter;
00266       std::vector<const my_float_t*>::iterator dest = bin.positions.begin();
00267       for(p_iter = pos_vec.begin(); p_iter < pos_vec.end(); ++p_iter, ++dest)
00268         *dest = *p_iter;
00269       bins->push_back(bin);
00270       return;
00271     }
00272     if(cnode.half_width <= max_dist){
00273       std::cerr << "Unhandled condition in bin_positions!" << std::endl;
00274       return;
00275     }
00276 
00277     std::vector< std::vector<const my_float_t*> > children_vectors(8);
00278     std::vector<const my_float_t*>::const_iterator pos_iter;
00279     for(pos_iter = pos_vec.begin(); pos_iter < pos_vec.end(); ++pos_iter){
00280       const my_float_t *pos = *pos_iter;
00281       size_t cube_idx = 0;
00282       if(*pos > cnode.centroid[0]) cube_idx += 1;
00283       ++pos;
00284       if(*pos > cnode.centroid[1]) cube_idx += 2;
00285       ++pos;
00286       if(*pos > cnode.centroid[2]) cube_idx += 4;
00287 
00288       if(*(cnode.children + cube_idx)) 
00289         (children_vectors.begin() + cube_idx)->push_back(*pos_iter);
00290     }
00291 
00292     octree_node_t<_Tp> **child_p = cnode.children;
00293     for(size_t i = 0; i < 8; ++i, ++child_p)
00294       if(*child_p) 
00295         bin_positions(**child_p, max_dist, children_vectors[i], bins);
00296   }
00297 
00298 /*
00299   bool 
00300   point_in_node(const my_float_t *pt, const octree_node_t &cnode, 
00301                 const my_float_t pt_tol)
00302   {
00303     my_float_t dist[3];
00304     for(size_t i = 0; i < 3; ++i){
00305       dist[i] = cnode.centroid[i] - pt[i];     
00306       dist[i] = (dist[i] < 0 ? -1.0 * dist[i] : dist[i]);
00307     }
00308  
00309     // If pt in box, return true
00310     if(dist[0] <= cnode.half_width && dist[1] <= cnode.half_width &&
00311        dist[2] <= cnode.half_width) return true;
00312 
00313     // If pt not in box + tol, return false
00314     if(dist[0] <= cnode.half_width + pt_tol && 
00315        dist[1] <= cnode.half_width + pt_tol &&
00316        dist[2] <= cnode.half_width + pt_tol) return false;
00317  
00318     // Project centroid to sphere with center at pt and radius pt_tol
00319     sphere S(pt, pt_tol);
00320     my_float_t pt_on_sphere[3];
00321     S.proj2surf(cnode.centroid, pt_on_sphere);
00322 
00323     // If projected centroid is in the box, return true
00324     // else return false 
00325     if(dist_squared(pt_on_sphere, pt) >= pt_tol * pt_tol) return false;
00326     return true; 
00327   }
00328 */                
00329  
00330   octree_node_t<_Tp> A_root;  
00331   uint A_max_numel; 
00332   my_float_t A_min_half_width;   
00333 
00334   static const std::string A_fname;  
00335 };
